channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pink Fire Retardant, a Dramatic Wildfire Weapon, Poses Its Own Dangers
item.description: It’s widely used because it can slow flames in ways that water can’t. But it also contains heavy metals and other harmful compounds.

item.title: Shui Ka-chun, Hong Kong Activist, Dies
item.description: A social worker and teacher imprisoned for his activism, he later wrote about the toll of incarceration and worked to help others behind bars.

item.title: Europe’s Airbus reports a boost in plane deliveries—despite struggles to regain pre-pandemic production levels
item.description: The figure was higher than the 735 aircraft Airbus delivered in 2023, but less than the 800 planes it had originally hoped to shift in 2024.

item.title: With Hearings Imminent, Partisan Fight Escalates Over Trump Cabinet
item.description: Democrats are demanding that Republicans slow consideration of picks for the new administration until they can review background checks, as the G.O.P....

item.title: Venezuela’s Autocrat Detains U.S. Citizens As He Tightens Grip on Power
item.description: President Nicolás Maduro will be sworn in for another six years on Friday, and he is hoping to use foreign prisoners to get his way on the global stag...

item.title: Canada eyes retaliation against U.S. orange juice and steel if Trump imposes tariffs
item.description: Donald Trump said this week he will use economic coercion to pressure Canada to become the nation’s 51st state.

item.title: Supreme Court to Hear Challenge to Law That Could Shut Down TikTok
item.description: The justices are expected to rule quickly in the case, which pits national security concerns about China against the First Amendment’s protection of f...

item.title: Lebanon Turns a Political Page as Hezbollah’s Hold Is Weakened
item.description: A stinging defeat in war has left the once untouchable group on its most uncertain footing in years.

item.title: Earth recorded its hottest year ever in 2024 and the jump was so big it breached the 1.5 degree Celsius threshold
item.description: “This is a warning light going off on the Earth’s dashboard that immediate attention is needed,'' said University of Georgia meteorology professor Mar...

item.title: Trump rattles his EU counterparts ahead of White House return—but here’s why Europe needs to keep Trump close
item.description: The incoming U.S. leader has pledged to end Russia's war in Ukraine, Europeans are also scrambling to avoid trade tariffs that Trump has mooted.

item.title: I’m a Climate Scientist. I Fled Los Angeles Two Years Ago.
item.description: After the Bobcat Fire, L.A. no longer felt safe.

item.title: Rare Winter Storm Sweeps Across the South: What to Know
item.description: A storm that brought snow and ice to the Gulf Coast states was moving east on Friday.

item.title: Death Toll Climbs in L.A. Fires, and TikTok’s Last Chance
item.description: Plus, goodbye to a hairy “Shrek” icon.

item.title: Goldilocks and the AI Revolution: Why mid-sized companies may be ‘just right’ for GenAI adoption
item.description: Mid-sized companies have the agility to reshape their business practices around GenAI—giving them an edge over huge corporations.
